snippet: Twitter and 300, a new company started by Lyor Cohen, one of music’s biggest power brokers, announced a partnership that hopes to analyze users’ posts to identify promising talent.
abstract: Twitter and 300, company started by music power brokers Lyor Cohen, announce partnership that hopes to analyze users’ posts to identify promising music talent; reading of music’s digital tea leaves has become big business as companies like Gracenote, Next Big Sound and Musicmetric have joined traditional players like Nielsen in providing information about music online.
lead_paragraph: Twitter and 300, a new company started by Lyor Cohen, one of music’s biggest power brokers, announced a partnership that hopes to analyze users’ posts to identify promising talent.

headline.main: Venture Will Mine Twitter for Music’s Next Big Thing
headline.print_headline: Venture Will Mine Twitter for Music’s Next Big Thing
